docs.text: CUDA, PyTorch and VSC Installation on Windows 10 last update: 2020-09-01 created: 2020-09-01 My old laptop(Thinkpad W520) has a GPU, i want to use it to learn some AI technologies, this notes lists the key steps to configure a Nvidia GPU enabled development environment 1. Review latest online guide -> 2. Find out the GPU Model info -> 3. find out the latest GPU driver version -> 4. determine the CUDA Toolkit version -> 5. Review the selected version CUDA toolkit online guide -> 6. Chose the VSC version and install -> 7. Install the CUDA tool kit -> 8. Chose the the PyTorch version and install Preparing Review the CUDA Installation Guide for Microsoft Windows , key points below: A CUDA-capable GPU A supported version of Microsoft Visual Studio A workable NVIDIA CUDA Toolkit version for your GPU Check GPU model, find driver version, determine CUDA Toolkit, VSC version Check the GPU model - NVIDIA Quadro 1000M Find the GPU driver latest version https://www.nvidia.com/Download/index.aspx?lang=en-us According the driver version number, determine which CUDA Toolkit version is workable for it https://docs.nvidia.com/cuda/cuda-toolkit-release-notes/index.html#major-components My GPU driver highest version is 377.55 , so the hightest workable CUDA toolkit version is v8.0.61 According the CUDA Toolkit version, choose the VSC version Change to CUDA Toolkit v8 online documents, review the installation guide https://docs.nvidia.com/cuda/archive/8.0/cuda-installation-guide-microsoft-windows/index.html The CUDA Toolkit version is v8, then i choose Visual Studio Community 2015 Install GPU driver https://www.nvidia.com/Download/driverResults.aspx/120734/en-us Install VSC Install Visual Studio Community 2015 . Make sure to include all C++ features Install CUDA Toolkit https://developer.nvidia.com/cuda-toolkit-archive https://developer.nvidia.com/cuda-80-ga2-download-archive Install CUDA toolkit v8.0.61 Install PyTorch(CUDA enabled) Review get started Find the highest PyTroch version which is available for CUDA toolkit v8. The version is v1.0.0 Download the pip whl packages: https://download.pytorch.org/whl/cu80/torch-1.0.0-cp37-cp37m-win_amd64.whl Create venv, and install pytorch 1 2 3 4 5 6 7 python -m venv cuda80 source cuda80/scripts/activate pip install torch-1.0.0-cp37-cp37m-win_amd64.whl pip install torchvision == 0 .2.1 # this package is needed by pytorch pip install numpy Verify the installation 1 2 3 4 5 6 7 8 import torch print ( torch . __version__ ) x = torch . rand ( 5 , 3 ) print ( x ) print ( torch . cuda . is_available () ) Next We can use the Nvidia CUDA Container to save time 1 docker pull nvidia/cuda:8.0-devel-ubuntu14.04 1. https://hub.docker.com/r/nvidia/cuda 2. https://gitlab.com/nvidia/container-images/cuda/blob/master/doc/unsupported-tags.md
docs.title: CUDA, PyTorch and VSC Installation on Windows 10

docs.text: Review the CUDA Installation Guide for Microsoft Windows , key points below: A CUDA-capable GPU A supported version of Microsoft Visual Studio A workable NVIDIA CUDA Toolkit version for your GPU
docs.title: Preparing

docs.text: Check the GPU model - NVIDIA Quadro 1000M Find the GPU driver latest version https://www.nvidia.com/Download/index.aspx?lang=en-us According the driver version number, determine which CUDA Toolkit version is workable for it https://docs.nvidia.com/cuda/cuda-toolkit-release-notes/index.html#major-components My GPU driver highest version is 377.55 , so the hightest workable CUDA toolkit version is v8.0.61 According the CUDA Toolkit version, choose the VSC version Change to CUDA Toolkit v8 online documents, review the installation guide https://docs.nvidia.com/cuda/archive/8.0/cuda-installation-guide-microsoft-windows/index.html The CUDA Toolkit version is v8, then i choose Visual Studio Community 2015
docs.title: Check GPU model, find driver version, determine CUDA Toolkit, VSC version

docs.text: https://www.nvidia.com/Download/driverResults.aspx/120734/en-us
docs.title: Install GPU driver

docs.text: Install Visual Studio Community 2015 . Make sure to include all C++ features
docs.title: Install VSC

docs.text: https://developer.nvidia.com/cuda-toolkit-archive https://developer.nvidia.com/cuda-80-ga2-download-archive Install CUDA toolkit v8.0.61
docs.title: Install CUDA Toolkit

docs.text: Review get started Find the highest PyTroch version which is available for CUDA toolkit v8. The version is v1.0.0 Download the pip whl packages: https://download.pytorch.org/whl/cu80/torch-1.0.0-cp37-cp37m-win_amd64.whl Create venv, and install pytorch 1 2 3 4 5 6 7 python -m venv cuda80 source cuda80/scripts/activate pip install torch-1.0.0-cp37-cp37m-win_amd64.whl pip install torchvision == 0 .2.1 # this package is needed by pytorch pip install numpy Verify the installation 1 2 3 4 5 6 7 8 import torch print ( torch . __version__ ) x = torch . rand ( 5 , 3 ) print ( x ) print ( torch . cuda . is_available () )
docs.title: Install PyTorch(CUDA enabled)

docs.text: We can use the Nvidia CUDA Container to save time 1 docker pull nvidia/cuda:8.0-devel-ubuntu14.04 1. https://hub.docker.com/r/nvidia/cuda 2. https://gitlab.com/nvidia/container-images/cuda/blob/master/doc/unsupported-tags.md
docs.title: Next

docs.text: How to use Google Analytics last update: 2020-08-28 created: 2020-08-28 What is Google Analytics It is used to help you understand how your web site are accessing. With it, you can learn which part of your web is good, or bad; you can know how many user was/are accessing your web, where are they from....; then you can improve the website accordingly. It is also for Android app, and iOS app. The steps to use it login google analytics Create Account - from Admin menu -> Account -> Create Account Create Property - from Admin menu -> Property -> Create Property The web site need to be verified by google before it can be analysis Check access the web site report -> real time Study the reports to enhance your website
docs.title: How to use Google Analytics

docs.text: last update: 2020-08-28 created: 2020-08-28
docs.title: How to use Google Analytics

docs.text: How Hugo support RobotsTxt last update: 2020-08-28 created: 2020-08-28 Configuration of RobotsTxt Config config.toml 1 2 3 enableRobotsTXT = true # production or non-production, usually production env would allow search engine to crawl everything [params].env = "production" run hugo command to generate the web site a robots.txt will be generated in public directory robots.txt templates are existing in layouts/robots.txt file, or themes/ananke/layouts/robots.txt file the templates would affects the content of the generated public/robots.txt RobotsTxt samples Which tells search engines that they are allowed to crawl everything: 1 2 User-agent: * Disallow: Which tells search engines that they are NOT allowed to crawl anything: 1 2 User-agent: * Disallow: /
docs.title: How Hugo support RobotsTxt

docs.text: last update: 2020-08-28 created: 2020-08-28
docs.title: How Hugo support RobotsTxt

docs.text: Config config.toml 1 2 3 enableRobotsTXT = true # production or non-production, usually production env would allow search engine to crawl everything [params].env = "production" run hugo command to generate the web site a robots.txt will be generated in public directory robots.txt templates are existing in layouts/robots.txt file, or themes/ananke/layouts/robots.txt file the templates would affects the content of the generated public/robots.txt
docs.title: Configuration of RobotsTxt
